TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventSource extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

summary.span: 提供为 Windows 事件跟踪 (ETW) 创建事件的功能。

span.span: Provides the ability to create events for event tracing for Windows (ETW).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类旨在提供要用于 ETW 的特定事件的用户类被继承。This class is intended to be inherited by a user class that provides specific events to be used for ETW. 调用方法来记录的事件。The methods are called to log the events. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `catch`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"使用对象实现 IDisposable"一节接口主题。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 基本功能足以满足大多数应用程序。The basic functionality of is sufficient for most applications. 如果你希望更好地控制创建的 ETW 清单，可以应用属性的方法。If you want more control over the ETW manifest that is created, you can apply the attribute to the methods. 对于高级的事件源应用程序，则可以将截获发送到派生的事件源的命令并更改筛选，或导致操作 （如转储数据结构） 是由继承者执行。For advanced event source applications, it is possible to intercept the commands being sent to the derived event source and change the filtering, or to cause actions (such as dumping a data structure) to be performed by the inheritor. 事件源可以立即激活与 Windows ETW 控制器，如 Logman 工具。An event source can be activated with Windows ETW controllers, such as the Logman tool, immediately. 还有可能以编程方式控制和截获数据调度程序。It is also possible to programmatically control and intercept the data dispatcher. 类提供其他功能。The class provides additional functionality. 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，提供已放宽通道支持以及一些事件源验证规则。Starting with [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], provides channel support and some of the event source validation rules have been relaxed. 这意味着：This means: - 类型现在可以实现接口。 types may now implement interfaces. 这样就可以使用接口来定义常见的日志记录目标的高级日志记录系统中的类型的事件源使用。This enables the use of event source types in advanced logging systems that use interfaces to define a common logging target. - 引入了实用工具事件源类型的概念。The concept of a utility event source type has been introduced. 此功能可跨多个事件源类型的项目中以启用方案，例如优化共享代码重载。This feature enables sharing code across multiple event source types in a project to enable scenarios such as optimized overloads. 有关的版本类，它提供功能，例如通道支持您面向[!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)]或更早版本，请参阅[Microsoft EventSource 库 1.0.16](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource)。For a version of the class that provides features such as channel support you are targeting [!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)] or earlier, see [Microsoft EventSource Library 1.0.16](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource). ## Examples 下面的示例演示的简单实现类。The following example shows a simple implementation of the class. [!code-csharp[ETWTraceSmall#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtracesmall/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ETWTraceSmall#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtracesmall/vb/program.vb#1)] 下面的示例演示的更复杂的实现类。The following example shows a more complex implementation of the class. [!code-csharp[ETWTrace#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtrace/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ETWTrace#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/etwtrace/vb/program.vb#1)]

summary.span: 释放 类的当前实例所使用的所有资源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 在调用`Dispose`，必须释放对所有引用这样垃圾回收器才能收回内存的占用。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清理了非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)并[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法由公共`Dispose()`方法和`Finalize`方法。This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the `Finalize` method. `Dispose()` 调用受保护`Dispose(Boolean)`方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. `Finalize` 调用`Dispose`与`disposing`设置为`false`。`Finalize` invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 `Dispose()` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

span.para: 可以多次调用由其他对象。重写时，请小心不要引用对象已释放在早期的 Dispose 方法调用。有关如何实现详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。有关详细信息并，请参阅[清理了非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed in an earlier the Dispose Method call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，编译器将调用此重载，如果调用的参数不匹配的另一个方法重载之一。By default, the compiler calls this overload if the parameters for the call do not match one of the other method overloads. 此重载是比其他重载，要慢得多，因为它执行以下任务：This overload is much slower than the other overloads, because it does the following: 1. 它会分配用于保存变量自变量的数组。It allocates an array to hold the variable argument. 2. 它将转换为对象 （这将导致为基元类型的分配） 到每个参数。It casts each parameter to an object (which causes allocations for primitive types). 3. 它将这些对象分配到的数组。It assigns these objects to the array. 4. 它将调用该函数，然后确定每个自变量的类型，因此它可以序列化的 ETW。It calls the function, which then determines the type of each argument so it can be serialized for ETW. 此重载的高开销并不重要时跟踪低容量事件，因为仅当启用的提供程序时使用的方法。The high overhead for this overload is not significant when tracing low-volume events, because the method is used only when the provider is enabled. 但是，对于大量事件，性能开销非常显著。However, for high-volume events, the performance overhead can be significant. 你可以避免使用通过创建新的、 更快的重载的大容量负载方法。You can avoid using for high-volume payloads by creating a new, faster overload with the method. `eventid` 应为大于 0 或小于 65535 或可以操作中发生错误。`eventid` should be greater than 0 or less than 65535 or errors can occur in the operation. 如果出现错误，请执行您可以通过检查的输出流的调试器，获取有关错误的源的详细信息，如果您有一个调试器附加到触发事件的过程。If errors do occur, you can get more information about the source of the error by checking the output stream of the debugger, if you have a debugger attached to the process firing events. 如果发生错误的事件源中有的 ETW 侦听器，还可以查看 ETW 事件流，以报告的错误。You can also look for errors reported in the ETW event stream, if you have an ETW listener on the event source where the error occurs. 当实现标识为中的 ETW 事件方法-派生的类。When you implement a method that is identified as an ETW event in an -derived class. 必须调用基类方法并传递和实现的方法类似于下面的示例相同的参数。You must call the base class method passing the and the same arguments as the implemented method similar to the following example. ```csharp [Event(2, Level = EventLevel.Informational)] public void Info1(string arg1) { base.WriteEvent(2, arg1); } ```

span.span: Writes an event that indicates that the current activity is related to another activity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法记录传输事件。The method logs a transfer event. 当前线程的活动记录使用事件，且这让两个活动相关的事件使用方。The activity of the current thread is logged with the event, and this allows two activities to be related by a consumer of events. ETW 事件方法调用此函数必须遵循以下准则：Your ETW event method calling this function must follow these guidelines: 1. 指定第一个参数为名为`relatedActivityId`。Specify the first parameter as a named `relatedActivityId`. 2. 指定或作为属性。Specify either or as the property. 3. 调用传递事件 ID，相关 ID GUID 后, 跟跟所有参数的事件方法中传递，相同的顺序。Call passing in the event ID, followed by the related ID GUID, followed by all the parameters the event method is passed, in the same order. 如果`args`是未使用，它将转换为对 ETW 的结果调用的空数组。If `args` is not used, it is converted to an empty array for the resulting call to ETW. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何可能指定调用的事件源。The following code example shows how you might can specify an event source that calls .
